trends: There have been 27 other sightings in Gainesville
There were no other sightings in Gainesville on or around June 3rd 2009
divs: sighting detailsi was on the front porch of the original pizza palace with my good friend dominic on june 3, 2009. at around 9:15 p.m. (correct to 20 minutes or so), i saw in the sky, to the northeast, and at about 20,000 ft, two bright white lights. i had been looking at the sky and the lights just appeared without seeming to come from anywhere. i immediately directed my friend's attention to the lights in the sky and he confirmed seeing what i was seeing (we also discussed and agreed afterwards on what we had seen). the lights appeared to belong to the same structure, for they were moving in tandem; but no structure could be seen - there were no clouds nearby. the two lights were each circular, white, bright, and about 2.5mm in diameter from where we were standing. at 9:15 p.m. in gainesville during the summer, it is dusk - so it was still sort of light out and the lights still appeared very bright. they were flashing on and off erratically and seemed to be jumping around in the sky (not all about the sky - from the ground, not more than an inch in any direction). the way that they were moving (the two lights possibly attached to a structure) looked a lot like typical computerized simulations of how electrons move - awkwardly, erratically, seem to be at more than one place at one time - like second 0:56 of this video http:\\www.youtube.com\watch?v=gsf7jhwr6ng except not as fast and, again, not as many - only two - and together. we watched for about 7 seconds as the lights moved strangely, while continuing to move in an east, northeast direction. after about seven seconds, the lights stopped moving erratically and just seemed to fly in a straight line, out of our field of vision (past some trees). there was no sound we could hear coming from the aircraft. the jackson naval air station is located to the northeast of gainesville, and the eglin air force base is to the west, in the panhandle. i don't think that what we saw belongs to either of the air force bases because what we saw did not come from anywhere. it just appeared in the sky. (unless the government was testing a flying object back-engineered from ufos or created with some secret innovation being kept from other american engineers and the u.s. department of transportation, and they'd forgotten to turn their lights on until they had flown about 200 miles).
Summary: Two bright, white, erratically flashing lights, seemingly belonging to one structure, jumping around in sky. Seen 10 seconds then passes tree line.
